column1: Learning about the Arctic and the organisms that live there is extremely difficult because this ocean is largely inaccessible. For much of the year
column2: thick ice prevents any ships from entering and the weather is too rough to carry out experiments. Because of this
column3: we only see snapshots of the processes that happen in the Arctic
column4: mostly in the summer months. Conditions in the Arctic Ocean are hostile
column7: cool summers. Average air temperatures in winter can fall to -34°C and rise up to 10°C in the summer
column8: although the ocean temperature remains steady at around -1.5 to -3°C. Much of the water is locked up as ice. Depending on how far north you are
column9: there can be up to almost half a year of complete darkness during the winter
column10: or 24-h of daylight during the summer.A lot of microbes live in or attached underneath sea ice. The ice that forms on the Arctic Ocean is not as solid as you might think.
